column4: so, is there a way to get CPU information (name) with uname -a ? How can I edit /bin/uname file?
what does your uname -a output now?
Linux c2d-desktop 2.6.30-rc6-core2duo #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat May 16 22:12:45 CEST 2009 x86_64 GNU/Linux
I am not 100% sure about this, but I think the data uname outputs is read from the kernel and is set at compile time.
